  • Constructor Details

    • SRZGTimeCalc

      public SRZGTimeCalc(Scanner input)
      Initializes the object's fields to their default values. Heroes Story has 6 tracks, Babylon Story has 7
      Parameters:
      input - it is shared throughout the entire program to be used for Scanner

    • setTimeArray

      public double[][] setTimeArray(double[][] timeArray)
      A general method to handle either Heroes or Babylon Story. For each track, the user is prompted to input the minutes and seconds, With lots of custom and normal exception handling. To make sure the program only accepts valid values
      Parameters:
      timeArray - used to store the minutes and seconds for each track in the specified story mode
      Returns:
      an updated timeArray that is all filled in

    • getTimeArrayString

      public String getTimeArrayString(double[][] timeArray, String storyString)
      Organizes the data from double[][] timeArray into a readable manner. Every row follows this format: "[track name]: X'YY"YY". X = minutes, Y = seconds. helper method for getStoryModeTimes()
      Parameters:
      timeArray - iterated thru to help create its formatted String version
      storyString - used to help determine what story mode we are handling
      Returns:
      a formatted String version of double[][] timeArray.

    • getStoryModeTimes

      public String getStoryModeTimes(String storyString)
      Where all the relevant data is in String form
      Parameters:
      storyString - used to assist which story mode we are working with
      Returns:
      the String outputs from both getTimeArrayString() and getFinalTimeString() combined, depending on storyString

    • printFormatInstructions

      public void printFormatInstructions()
      Tells the user the time input format they will use so that Scanner input can read it. Run directly by main method

    • run

      public void run()
      Everything happening in the code ultimately gets printed from here. Run directly by main method
